2026-02-01.content:
The **Case Federation** feature is no longer dependent on the **Case Federation** integration in the primary platform.

The primary platform sync job is now disabled. Do not attempt to re-enable it.

For more information, see [Set up case federation access for SOAR](https://docs.cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/admin-tasks/environments/case-federation).

summary.title: Case Federation Update
summary.summary: Case Federation is now independent of the primary platform integration. The primary platform sync job has been disabled and should not be re-enabled.

summary.title: New release available
summary.summary: Release 6.3.73 is now available in all regions. This update includes the latest features and improvements.

2026-01-26.content:
**Timeline View for Alerts**

Visualize alert patterns over time using the new timeline view in the **Alerts** section of the **Cases Overview** tab.

summary.title: Alerts timeline view
summary.summary: The new timeline view in the Alerts section of the Cases Overview tab allows you to visualize alert patterns over time.

2026-01-25.content:
**Integration Rollback**

This [Integration Rollback](https://docs.cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/release-notes#January_18_2026) feature is now in General Availability (GA).

Rollback is not supported for integrations built for Python 2.7 or 3.7. To perform a rollback, a snapshot must have been created during the previous upgrade process.
For more information, see [Roll back response integration version](https://docs.cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/respond/integrations-setup/version-rollback).

summary.title: Integration Rollback Now Available
summary.summary: The Integration Rollback feature has reached General Availability. This allows for reverting integration versions, provided a snapshot was taken during the upgrade. Note that rollbacks are not supported for Python 2.7 or 3.7 integrations.

2026-01-25.content:
**Structured SOAR Python integration logs**

Python integration logging has been upgraded to a structured format to eliminate visibility gaps and ensure comprehensive diagnostic coverage in Google Cloud.  
This upgrade changes how Python logs are interpreted in the GCP Cloud Logging Explorer. Previously, logs were bundled into a single block per execution. Now, every log line is interpreted as a separate entry, allowing for granular filtering, better searchability, and easier debugging of specific events.

**Recommended Actions:**

* **Update Log-Based Alerts:** Ensure alerts triggered by string matches are compatible with individual log entries rather than bundled blocks.
* **Review Automation Scripts:** Test any external scripts or BigQuery exports that parse textPayload against the new granular format.
* **Verify Dashboards:** Custom monitoring dashboards may show an increase in event counts as executions are no longer bundled.

For more information, see [Collect SOAR logs](https://docs.cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/investigate/collecting-soar-logs).

summary.title: Structured Python Integration Logs
summary.summary: Python integration logs are now structured for better visibility and debugging in Cloud Logging. Each log line is a separate entry, enabling granular filtering and searchability. Update alerts and review parsing scripts to accommodate this change.

2026-01-18.content:
**Integration Rollback**

This feature is currently in Preview.

You can now roll back commercial response integrations to their previously installed version. This action reverts all integration content, including standard code and any custom modifications, to the state of the last installed version. For more information, see [Roll back response integration version](https://docs.cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/respond/integrations-setup/version-rollback).

summary.title: Integration Rollback Now Available
summary.summary: You can now roll back commercial response integrations to their previously installed version. This action reverts all integration content, including standard code and custom modifications, to the state of the last installed version.

2026-01-17.content: [Release 6.3.71](https://docs.cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/release-notes#January_11_2026) is now available for all regions.

summary.title: New Version Available
summary.summary: The latest version of Chronicle SOAR, 6.3.71, has been released and is now available in all regions. This update includes various improvements and bug fixes.

2026-01-11.content:
**Custom Transformers and Logical Operators**

This feature is currently in Preview.

Playbook engineers can now extend platform capabilities by creating custom Python-based transformation functions and logical operators as part of Extension Packs directly within the IDE. For more information, see [Custom transformation functions and logical operators](https://docs.cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/respond/custom-transformers-logical-operators).

summary.title: Extend Platform with Custom Logic
summary.summary: You can now create custom Python-based transformation functions and logical operators using Extension Packs within the IDE. This feature allows playbook engineers to extend the platform's capabilities, enhancing automation and analysis.

2026-01-11.content:
Release 6.3.71 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions as listed [here](https://docs.cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/overview-and-introduction/soar-gradual-release).

This release contains the following changes:

summary.title: New Chronicle Release Available
summary.summary: Release 6.3.71 is now rolling out to initial regions. This update includes important changes and improvements to the platform.

2026-01-11.content:
**Terminate Playbook capability**

You can now manually terminate a running playbook directly from the Playbook Viewer in the Case Overview. This provides a mechanism to immediately end execution if a loop encounters unwanted or excessive iterations.

summary.title: Terminate Running Playbooks
summary.summary: You can now manually terminate a running playbook directly from the Playbook Viewer. This new feature allows you to immediately end execution if a playbook encounters unwanted or excessive iterations.

2026-01-11.content:
**Increased iteration and step limits for Playbook Loops**

To support larger automation requirements, the maximum number of iterations for a single loop has been increased to 1,000, and the number of supported steps within a loop has been increased to 100.

summary.title: Expanded Playbook Loop Capabilities
summary.summary: Playbook loops now support up to 1,000 iterations and 100 steps, enabling more complex automation workflows. These enhancements accommodate larger-scale automation requirements.

2026-01-11.content:
**Playbook Loops**

This feature is now in General Availability (GA).
For more information, see [Automate tasks with Playbook Loops](https://docs.cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/respond/working-with-playbooks/playbook-loops).

summary.title: Playbook Loops Now Generally Available
summary.summary: Playbook Loops, a feature designed to automate tasks, has now reached General Availability. This enhancement allows for more efficient and streamlined workflows in managing security operations.

  stabilizing the order based on the keys of the first object in the list in the
  following action:

summary.title: CSV Version 34.0 Update
summary.summary: The latest update to CSV (version 34.0) includes a fix for inconsistent column order in the Save JSON to CSV action. The column order will now be stable, based on the keys of the first JSON object.

summary.summary: Release 6.3.62 is now available in initial regions, following the established release plan. This update includes several important changes.

2025-09-28.content:
**Podman support for Remote Agents**

You can now install a Remote Agent using Podman. This new functionality provides a streamlined deployment workflow—a lightweight alternative to existing installation methods.

For more information, see [Deploy an agent with Podman](https://docs.cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/working-with-remote-agents/deploy-agent-with-podman).

summary.title: Podman support for Remote Agents
summary.summary: Install a Remote Agent using Podman for a streamlined, lightweight deployment.

2025-09-28.content:
**Deploy an agent with Debian**

You can now install a Remote Agent using Debian. This new functionality provides a streamlined deployment workflow—an alternative to existing installation methods.

For more information, see [Deploy an agent with Debian](https://docs.cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/working-with-remote-agents/create-agent-with-installer-on-debian).

summary.title: Agent Deployment on Debian
summary.summary: A new feature allows for streamlined agent deployment using Debian.

summary.title: Remote Agent 2.5.0
summary.summary: New release of Remote Agent available.

**Increased Alert Trimming limit for Remote Agent**

The default setting for Alert Trimming has been increased to 25 MB.

summary.title: Increased Alert Trimming limit
summary.summary: The default setting for Alert Trimming has been increased to 25 MB.

2025-09-28.content:
**Publisher Connector package size limit enforced**

The maximum allowed size for a Publisher's Connector Package is now limited to 25 MB.

summary.title: Connector Package Size Limit
summary.summary: The maximum size for a Publisher's Connector Package is now 25 MB.

2025-09-16.content:
**Migrate SOAR to Google Cloud**

All customers and partners are being migrated from SOAR to Google Cloud. For more information, see [SOAR migration overview](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/admin-tasks/advanced/migrate-to-gcp) and [FAQ](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/admin-tasks/advanced/migrate-soar-faq).

summary.title: SOAR Migration to Google Cloud
summary.summary: All customers and partners are being migrated from SOAR to Google Cloud. This transition is part of an ongoing effort to enhance our services and provide a more robust platform. For detailed information and assistance, please refer to the SOAR migration overview and FAQ resources.

summary.title: Release 6.3.60 Available
summary.summary: The latest update, Release 6.3.60, has been deployed and is now accessible across all regions.

2025-09-07.content:
Release 6.3.61 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions, as outlined in our [Google SecOps release plan](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/overview-and-introduction/soar-gradual-release).

This release contains the following features:

summary.title: Release 6.3.61 Rolling Out
summary.summary: Release 6.3.61 is now available in the initial set of regions, following the established release plan. This update introduces new features designed to enhance our offerings.

2025-09-07.content:
**Advanced job scheduling**

The job scheduling functionality has been enhanced with advanced options. This functionality provides more precise control and flexible, calendar-like scheduling for your scripts.

For more information, see [Configure a new job with advanced scheduling](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/respond/jobs-scheduler/writing-jobs#advanced-scheduling).

summary.title: Advanced job scheduling
summary.summary: Enhanced job scheduling with advanced options for precise control and flexible, calendar-like scheduling of scripts.

2025-09-07.content:
**Use custom fields in the Close Case dialog**

Administrators can now add custom fields to the **Close Case** dialog. This new functionality provides a more streamlined workflow and replaces the **Dynamic Fields** feature.

For more information, see [Use custom fields in the Close Case dialog](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/investigate/working-with-cases/custom-fields-in-case-closure).

summary.title: New Custom Fields for Case Closure
summary.summary: Administrators can now add custom fields to the Close Case dialog, streamlining workflows. This feature replaces the older Dynamic Fields functionality.

summary.title: New Release Available
summary.summary: Release 6.3.57 is now available.

2025-08-10.content:
Release 6.3.57 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions, as outlined in our [Google SecOps release plan](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/overview-and-introduction/soar-gradual-release).

This release contains the following features:

summary.title: Release 6.3.57 Rollout
summary.summary: Release 6.3.57 is rolling out now.

2025-08-10.content:
**Expression Builder enhancements**

The **Expression Builder** has been enhanced with a new set of pre-built filters to help streamline query creation.

We've improved the information within the platform for all filters, both new and existing. The supporting documentation provides clearer descriptions and practical examples for each transformer, making it easier to understand their purpose and syntax.

For details, see [Use the Expression Builder](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/respond/working-with-playbooks/using-the-expression-builder).

summary.title: Expression Builder Enhancements
summary.summary: New filters in Expression Builder.

2025-08-10.content:
**Remote agent notifications**

Agent notifications will alert you to new remote agent version releases and agent downtime based on your permissions and associated environments. Agent notifications are now enabled by default. You can opt out of these notifications at any time from your user preferences.

For details, see [Agent notifications](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/working-with-remote-agents/what-is-a-remote-agent#agent-notifications).

summary.title: Remote Agent Notifications
summary.summary: Agent notifications alert you to new remote agent version releases and agent downtime.

2025-08-09.content: [Release 6.3.56](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/release-notes#August_3_2025) is now available for all regions.

summary.title: New Release Available
summary.summary: Release 6.3.56 is now available.

2025-08-03.content:
Release 6.3.56 is rolling out to the first phase of regions, as outlined in our [Google SecOps release plan](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/overview-and-introduction/soar-gradual-release).

This release includes the following features:

summary.title: New Release Available
summary.summary: Release 6.3.56 is now available in initial regions.

2025-08-03.content:
**Automated retries for failed playbook actions**

This feature is in Preview.

Playbook functionality now supports automatic retries for individual actions that encounter temporary issues, such as network outages, API rate limits, or service unavailability. You can define the number of retry attempts and the intervals between retries directly at the step level within playbooks.

For more information on configuring and using action retries, see [Configure action retries in playbooks](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/respond/working-with-playbooks/retry-actions).

summary.title: New: Automated retries for playbook actions
summary.summary: Automated retries for playbook actions.

2025-08-03.content:
**Custom Fields Form widget is now supported in Playbook View**

The **Custom Fields Form** widget is now supported in Playbook View.

summary.title: Feature Announcement: Custom Fields Form widget in Playbook View
summary.summary: Custom Fields Form widget now supported in Playbook View.

2025-08-02.content: [Release 6.3.55](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/release-notes#July_27_2025) is now available for all regions.

summary.title: New Release
summary.summary: Release 6.3.55 is now available.

2025-07-27.content:
Release 6.3.55 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions, as outlined in our [Google SecOps release plan](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/overview-and-introduction/soar-gradual-release).

This release contains the following features:

summary.title: New Release
summary.summary: Release 6.3.55 is rolling out to initial regions.

2025-07-27.content:
**Automate tasks with Playbook Loops**

This feature is in Preview.

Playbook functionality has been enhanced to include **Playbook Loops**. This feature update lets playbooks iterate over lists or entities, performing one or more actions for each item. It streamlines automation by eliminating the need for duplicated steps or custom actions when processing multiple items. You can configure Playbook Loops directly within a playbook or inside a playbook block.

For setup instructions and use case examples , see [Automate tasks with Playbook Loops](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/respond/working-with-playbooks/playbook-loops).

summary.title: Playbook Loops
summary.summary: Streamline automation by iterating over lists or entities.

2025-07-27.content:
**Playbook Simulator enhancements for loops**

The Playbook Simulator now supports visualization and debugging of playbooks that contain loops. This lets you clearly see and navigate through each loop iteration within the simulator viewer.

Additionally, the step display order has been updated to show actions from top to bottom (oldest at the top, newest at the bottom), with automatic scrolling to the most recent activity.

For more details, see [Loops in the Playbook Simulator](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/respond/working-with-playbooks/playbook-loops#loops-in-the-playbook-simulator).

summary.title: Playbook Simulator loop enhancements
summary.summary: Visualize and debug playbooks with loops.

2025-07-13.content:
Release 6.3.53 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions as listed [here](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/overview-and-introduction/soar-gradual-release).

This release contains internal and customer bug fixes.

summary.title: Release 6.3.53 Rollout Begins

2025-07-12.content: [Release 6.3.52](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/release-notes#July_06_2025) is now available for all regions.

summary.title: New release available
summary.summary: The latest release, version 6.3.52, is now available across all regions. This update includes various improvements and new features for the platform.

2025-07-06.content:
Release 6.3.52 is being rolled out to the first phase of regions as listed [here](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/overview-and-introduction/soar-gradual-release).

This release contains the following feature:

summary.title: New Release Available
summary.summary: Release 6.3.52 is now available in initial regions. This update includes new features and improvements.

2025-07-06.content:
**Share Case Queue Filters**

You can now share case queue filters with other users. These filters can be saved with specific criteria, such as assignee roles, and shared with individual users, SOC roles, or all users in your organization for quick access.

For more information, see [Apply and save filters](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/investigate/working-with-cases/apply-and-save-filters).

summary.title: Share Case Queue Filters
summary.summary: Users can now share saved case queue filters with specific criteria with other users, roles, or everyone in the organization for easier access.

This release contains the following change.

summary.title: New Release Available
summary.summary: Release 6.3.51 is now available in the initial set of regions. This update includes a new feature that will be detailed in upcoming communications.

2025-06-29.content:
**Bulk Playbook Duplication Behavior Updated**

When duplicating playbooks in bulk, the original selection is now preserved. Newly created copies are no longer automatically selected in the platform.

summary.title: Bulk Playbook Duplication Behavior Updated
summary.summary: The platform no longer automatically selects newly created copies when duplicating playbooks in bulk. The original selection is now preserved.

summary.summary: This is the second, longer summary. Release 6.3.48 is now available in the initial set of regions.

2025-06-07.content:
**Playbook Permissions: Support for API Key Roles**

The platform has been updated to extend playbook permissions to also support the SOC Roles associated with API keys, in addition to the user SOC Roles.

This enhancement affects how integrations using API keys interact with playbooks that have specific permission configurations. For example, GitSync now uses this capability to synchronize playbooks with restricted permissions.

For more information on how playbook permissions work with users and API keys, see [Playbook permissions](http://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/respond/working-with-playbooks/playbook-permissions).

For specific instructions on configuring GitSync with restricted playbooks, see [GitSync - Work with playbook permissions](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/marketplace/power-ups/gitsync#work-with-playbook-permissions).

summary.title: API Key Role Support for Playbook Permissions
summary.summary: Playbook permissions now support API key roles, enhancing how integrations with specific permission configurations interact with playbooks. This change impacts features like GitSync, which now synchronizes playbooks with restricted permissions.

2025-06-07.content:
**Advanced Reports: Case Custom Fields**

Advanced Reports (Looker) has been enhanced to include support for custom fields created for Cases.

This enhancement allows users to leverage organization-specific data captured in custom fields to gain deeper insights and create tailored visualizations within Looker reports. Specific LookML formulas and filtering guidance are now available.

For more information on how to use custom fields in Advanced Reports, see [Use Custom Fields in Advanced Reports](https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/investigate/working-with-cases/adding-custom-fields#use-custom-fields-in-advanced-reports).

summary.title: Advanced Reports Now Support Case Custom Fields
summary.summary: Looker reports now support custom fields for Cases, enabling users to analyze organization-specific data and create tailored visualizations. Guidance on LookML formulas and filtering is available.
